docs.snippet: The Soviet Union, reversing an earlier decision, granted a visa yesterday to Bernard Levinson, president of the Association of Jewish Book Publishers, to attend the Fifth Moscow International Book Fair, which begins Tuesday.   No similar action ha...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Soviet Union, reversing an earlier decision, granted a visa yesterday to Bernard Levinson, president of the Association of Jewish Book Publishers, to attend the Fifth Moscow International Book Fair, which begins Tuesday. No similar action has been taken, however, for two other Americans who applied for visas to attend the fair - Robert Bernstein, president of Random House, and Jeri Laber, an aide with the Association of American Publishers. Mr. Bernstein is chairman of the Helsinki Watch Committee, a human rights group that monitors compliance with the 1975 Helsinki accords, and Miss Laber is executive director of the group. Although the Association of American Publishers made appeals to Soviet officials in Washington and Moscow on behalf of the others denied permission to attend the fair, visas are not expected to be granted for Mr. Bernstein and Miss Laber because of their affiliation with Helsinki Watch.

headline.main: SOVIET LIFTS BAN ON 1 U.S. DELEGATE

keywords.name: organizations

docs.snippet: Israel's interior minister, Ophir Pines-Paz, put an additional 12-month travel ban on Mordechai Vanunu, who served a prison sentence for revealing nuclear secrets. When Mr. Vanunu was released a year ago, the government imposed a one-year ban on l...
docs.lead_paragraph: Israel's interior minister, Ophir Pines-Paz, put an additional 12-month travel ban on Mordechai Vanunu, who served a prison sentence for revealing nuclear secrets. When Mr. Vanunu was released a year ago, the government imposed a one-year ban on leaving the country. Mr. Pines-Paz said, ''It is clear to me that his motivation to damage state security and to make public highly secret information has not lessened.'' Greg Myre (NYT)

headline.main: World Briefing | Middle East: Israel Extends Vanunu Travel Ban
